snippet: A parliamentary seat has been granted to the head of a sectarian group that has long been accused of inciting violence against minority Shiites.
abstract: Pakistan’s electoral commission grants parliamentary seat to Maulana Muhammad Ahmed Ludhianvi, leader of banned sectarian group Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat, which has long been accused of inciting violence against minority Shiites; Ludhianvi lost the seat during the May 2013 election but appealed on the basis that incumbent Sheikh Muhammad Akram had rigged the vote and defaulted on bank loans.

byline.contributor: Waqar Gillani contributed reporting from Lahore, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: A parliamentary seat has been granted to the head of a sectarian group that has long been accused of inciting violence against minority Shiites.

headline.main: Banned Group’s Leader Given Pakistani Parliament Seat After Vote Dispute
headline.print_headline: Banned Group’s Leader Given Pakistani Parliament Seat After Vote Dispute
